title: Is life really just about living your life? - Quora

response.answer_text: You wake up early in the morning.You get ready with the most priority for your office/work.You work there as necessarily and a habitual manner.Think about to get free from your work or get some rest.Returned at your home. Take a little rest. Enjoy in your way for overcome with entire tiredness.Go to bed for all the recursive process for the next day.(Excluding weekends, I think.)All the lines represent that ‘It is really about living your life.’ And……………….”” You wake up early in the morning with few efforts for your physical and mental development.You get ready with the most priority for your office/work for earning to get all the needs for you, your family. For consume all the facilities.You work there as necessarily and a habitual manner for learning something new or for your own personality development.Think about to get free from your work or get some rest for increase your productivity.Think about to get free from your work or get some rest for make yourself comfort.Returned at your home. Take a little rest. Enjoy in your way for overcome with entire tiredness and for it you woke up early in the morning.Go to bed for all the recursive process for the next day with new hopes, new plannings and for make life little bit better.Now all these similar, modified lines although indicate living life but in all these you have a purpose, a motto for all your activities and the previous lines are showing that someone is living his/her life just for ‘living’(Without any purpose or without any motto). So yes life is all about living but its all about in which manner you are living it…!!! Thank You…!!!

Yep, pretty much. But there’s a lot of depth and nuance to that. It’s about HOW you live your life. If you pursue becoming the best person that you can be, in every context, you’re on the right track. Cultivate interests in things that please you, without causing harm to others. If possible, cultivate interests in things that actually benefit others, but at the very least do no harm. Find things you are good at, and practice until you are even better. Try things that are hard, and don’t give up at the first go-round. Challenge yourself, physically and mentally - always push your own boundaries. You may not be great at everything, and that’s ok, but in the process you’ll find things you do really well, and those will give you satisfaction that will carry you through the inevitable low points. By working on yourself, and being honest with yourself about your strengths and weaknesses, you’ll be the kind of person that other people will respect. Be honest, with yourself and others, and keep your word. All the rest will fall into place. It might sound simple, and in one sense it is - just be honest and true to yourself, push yourself to be better tomorrow than yesterday, set some goals and stick to them. Life just happens - it’s what you do with it that counts.
